meanings.definition: To cause something unpleasant or painful to be suffered by someone
meanings.sent1: Bullying can inflict emotional pain on others.
meanings.sent2: The bully tried to inflict harm on his classmates.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten thought it would be fun to inflict scratches on the furniture.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to inflict its wrath on the small town.
meanings.sent5: The haunted house was designed to inflict fear on visitors.

meanings.definition: To impose something unwelcome or harmful on someone
meanings.sent1: The strict teacher would inflict extra homework on the students.
meanings.sent2: The dictator would inflict harsh punishments on those who opposed him.
meanings.sent3: The prankster decided to inflict a silly joke on his friend.
meanings.sent4: The virus seemed to inflict chaos on the computer system.
meanings.sent5: The magician's spell was meant to inflict confusion on the audience.
